Exaggerate: The claim in the Facebook posts exaggerates the context of the video by falsely claiming that it shows Uighur children praying in Xinjiang, when in fact it shows children at a religious event in Kyrgyzstan.
Contradict fact: The claim made in the Facebook posts contradicts the fact that the video actually shows children in Kyrgyzstan, not Xinjiang.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misleading video and does not provide any credible evidence to support the assertion that it shows Uighur children praying in Xinjiang.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the video shows Uighur children praying in Xinjiang without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the video actually shows children at a religious event in Kyrgyzstan, as confirmed by a Kyrgyz-speaking journalist and the original source of the video.
